meanings.definition: A row of electrolytic cells used in the production of aluminum.
meanings.sent1: The factory had multiple potlines running to make aluminum.
meanings.sent2: The workers checked the potlines daily to ensure smooth production.
meanings.sent3: The potlines in the factory decided to have a race to see which one was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The glowing potlines resembled a river of molten metal flowing through the plant.
meanings.sent5: The loud hum of the potlines echoed through the aluminum factory.

meanings.definition: The process of forming or creating rows of electrolytic cells for aluminum production.
meanings.sent1: Setting up the potlines required careful planning and precision.
meanings.sent2: The engineers studied the best techniques for establishing potlines efficiently.
meanings.sent3: During the aluminum conference, they held a contest for the most creative potlines design.
meanings.sent4: The expansion of the company involved expanding the potlines to increase production capacity.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the synchronized movement of the potlines was mesmerizing to watch.
